meanings.definition: To edit (a text) incorrectly or poorly.
meanings.sent1: She kept misediting her essay by deleting important paragraphs.
meanings.sent2: He realized he was misediting the document when he accidentally removed all the footnotes.
meanings.sent3: The misediting of the recipe made it seem like you needed a gallon of salt instead of a teaspoon.
meanings.sent4: Her misediting of the report turned it into a confusing puzzle for the readers to decipher.
meanings.sent5: Misediting can lead to misunderstandings and confusion in written work.

meanings.definition: The act of editing a text incorrectly or poorly.
meanings.sent1: The misediting of the article resulted in several factual errors being published.
meanings.sent2: He noticed the misediting in the book when he found multiple spelling mistakes on every page.
meanings.sent3: The misediting in the newspaper made the front page story sound like a comedy sketch.
meanings.sent4: The misediting of the manuscript turned it into a jumbled mess of incoherent sentences.
meanings.sent5: Careful proofreading can help prevent misediting in important documents.
